recipe.ingredients: - salmon fillets: 4 (6 ounces each) - quinoa: 1 cup - water: 2 cups - cherry tomatoes (halved): 1 cup - cucumber (diced): 1 - red onion (finely chopped): 1/2 cup - fresh parsley (chopped): 1/3 cup - lemon juice: 3 tablespoons - olive oil: 2 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 1 clove - salt: 1/2 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Cook Quinoa: Rinse the quinoa under cold water. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it cool. 2. Prepare Salmon: Preheat the grill or oven to medium heat. Season the salmon with salt and black pepper. Grill or bake the salmon for about 5 to 6 minutes on each side or until cooked through and flaky. 3. Make Salad: In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley. 4. Prepare Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. 5. Combine: Pour the dressing over the quinoa salad and mix well. Top with grilled or baked salmon. 6. Serve: Divide the salad among plates and serve with the salmon on top.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 40g, Dietary Fiber: 6g, Sodium: 350mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 18g, Protein: 36g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 3g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 1996 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Salmon Fillets: 1440 calories (360 calories per fillet) Quinoa: 222 calories for 1 cup cooked Cherry Tomatoes: 32 calories for 1 cup Cucumber: 8 calories for 1 medium Red Onion: 32 calories per 1/2 cup Parsley: 11 calories per 1/3 cup Lemon Juice: 10 calories per 3 tablespoons Olive Oil: 239 calories per 2 tablespoons Garlic: Minimal Salt, Black Pepper: Minimal - Serving People: 4
